content.description: The starting holds on this route already had chalk on them, so if whoever first climbed this is on Mountain Project, please contact me so I can change the name and credit you as the FA. The problem starts on crimps and goes left to a juggy pocket. Go up to the lip and get up the large mantle.
content.location: Not on the Maddox boulder, but on the small boulder to the right of it. This is the problem to the right of Colombian Bang-Bang.

content.description: To the far left of the Maddox Boulder. Look for the improved and leveled landing near the Rhodos. Stand start and work up small holds to set up for a big move to a "blind" hold. Once past the crux, follow directly to the top.

Find the large to the right-most side of the Maddox Wall. About 8ft to the left of this tree is the start to Maddox Right.

Begin matched in a nice, deeper jug and trend up and right through smaller holds toward the lip. Make a large move to a nice slopey scoop. Avoid dabbing the tree and slab your way to glory up the tall face above.

This is a low traverse into the start of Maddox Right.

Look 8ft left of the start to "Right Maddox" and find the chunky feature at waist height and start matched. Work low and right to link into the "Right" start to finish as per.
Start on small crimp rail with feet at the bottom of the overhang. Go left to a slightly deeper pocket and then up to the lip. Negotiate the weird top out that goes slightly to the left.
content.location: Not actually on the Maddox boulder, but the small boulder to the right. Good lowball for those who are scared of fully topping out Maddox and want something slightly different. This problem is on the left side of this small boulder.
